synopsis: A freelance writer hears a rumor that a plane landed with no passengers. He goes inside and finds a lone surviving stewardess, then he finds she's not alone at all...
Banba is being transported on a train that's attacked by one of the kagewani. The monster spits acid and devours people. Can he stop it before the train plunges off a cliff?
A man travels with his girlfriend to an isolated hot springs. When his girlfriend disappears, the owners of the inn insist she was never here. But she actually is going to be sacrificed to a monster!

Banba is brought to meet an old friend: Kimura, who supposedly died during the explosion at Sarugaku. Banba is made an offer he can't refuse, but he has an ace up his sleeve: the power of the Kagewani.
Dr. Banba is attacked by a ninja with a powerful anti-Kagewani weapon. Alone and stranded on a roof, he is helpless against her. But a familiar face arrives out of nowhere and intervenes-
One of the kagewani beasts appears at a shopping mall where a scientist is shopping with his blind daughter. His daughter is trapped inside: will he be able to rescue her?
A woman is sent alone into the snowy mountains. Her mission: to find and recover a human/Kagewani hybrid. But the arrival of another beast throws a wrench into her plans...
Dr. Banba is absorbed by the memories of the Kagewani, and the terrifying, sorrowful past of the man trapped within it.

Director Honma uses Banba as a method to control the Kagewani beasts and sell their powers to armies all around the world. When his presentation goes drastically wrong, Kimura leaves him to die. But can Banba escape?
Banba decides that the girl from the Yaguru clan his only clue to the kagewani. He sets a trap to lure her out, but will she survive the kagewani's attacks long enough to fall for it?
Banba tracks the Kagewani to its lair, only to discover a horrifying truth: the Kagewani has evolved.
The final battle for the Kagewani draws to an end, but a hidden enemy reveals himself.
